metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2010 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: CAPI). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.50 and prior, 5.7.32 andprior and 8.0.22 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQLClient accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denialof service (partial DOS) of MySQL Client. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.2(Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.33-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
